hints.content:
We can think of $\blueD{10} \times \greenD{9}$ as $\blueD{10}$ rows of $\greenD{9}$ circles. How many circles are there?

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: An array of 90 circles arranged in 10 rows of 9 circles each. The rows are labeled 1 through 10. The columns are labeled 1 through 9. Every circle is labeled with a number. The circles in the first row are labeled 1 through 9. The circles in the second row are labeled 10 through 18. The circles in the third row are labeled 19 through 27. The circles in the fourth row are labeled 28 through 36. The circles in the fifth row are labeled 37 through 45. The circles in the sixth row are labeled 46 through 54. The circles in the seventh row are labeled 55 through 63. The circles in the eighth row are labeled 64 through 72. The circles in the ninth row are labeled 73 through 81. The circles in the tenth row are labeled 82 through 90. !
